New Records: Quinton de Kock scored his 20th ODI century and his third of this World Cup.
South Africa achieved their seventh consecutive 300-plus total batting first in ODIs.
Quinton de Kock surpassed AB de Villiers in ODI centuries for South Africa.
Key Match Events: Mahmudullah scored a century for Bangladesh, his third in World Cups.
Quinton de Kock scored 174 off 140 balls.
Heinrich Klaasen scored a quick fifty off 34 balls.
Marco Jansen took two wickets in two balls.
Mustafizur Rahman was dismissed by Lizaad Williams.
Bangladesh were bowled out for 233 in 46.4 overs.
Pre-Game Insights: Shakib Al Hasan returned to the Bangladesh team after an injury.
Temba Bavuma was ruled out due to a gastric illness.
Lungi Ngidi missed the match due to a knee niggle.
Post-Match Reflections: South Africa moved to second place on the points table with the best NRR of 2.370.
Bangladesh remained at the bottom of the table with four consecutive losses.
Shakib Al Hasan expressed the need for Bangladesh to improve in several areas including batting, bowling, and fielding.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played at Wankhede Stadium, Mumbai.
The weather was hot and humid, affecting players' performance.
The match was held on a public holiday for the Hindu festival Dussehra.
South Africa scored 144 runs in the last 10 overs of their innings.
